events.name: Tech Saturday: Prototyping 101
events.description:
In Tech Saturday, volunteers will be using tech to address sustainability issues. We meet on Saturdays to learn and do projects together! Each project typically requires 8-10 weeks to complete and will include release of multiple challenge statements, ideation, prototyping and iteration/ testing of the prototypes.

First Season will be from 4th Feb to 25th Mar 2017, 9.00 am onwards.

For our first meeting on 4th Feb 2017, we would:
- Conduct Project Briefing & Lab Induction
- Form teams to work on different projects
- Learn about the fundamentals of prototyping

Here's the possible projects we can work on:
- DIY Bio Lab: Microscope, Centrifuge, Magnetic Stir Plate
- Food Waste Reduction: Solar Dryer, Composters

If you would like to join, please sign up here: 
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdvgPhp5HrY01Rg44tqmxxJgjGkpHrSkJw6PyxnWcPimWCyrA/viewform?c=0&w=1 


Why do we do this?
We would like to bring people from diverse background and skills together and create synergy for the purpose of sustainability. We would also like to experiment with Open Source Hardware Development, Circular Design and Frugal Engineering.

Is there any Pre-requisite to join?
Prior background in related topics e.g. science, engineering and design will help, but we welcome all who are willing to learn and commit to the projects. 

Is it free to join?
Yes! 
Note: Your contribution to the projects e.g. for material will be greatly appreciated.  

What do I need to bring?
Bring your laptops so that we can go through some of the digital contents conveniently. Also, wear comfortable clothing and covered shoe as we will be doing hands-on project in the makerspace.
events.location: Community Lab at Uwcsea East Campus - Tampines, 1 Tampines Street 73, 528704, Singapore 528704

events.name: Introduction to HTML and CSS - hackerschool
events.description:
Venue: NUS School of Computing COM1 02-12 (Seminar Room 3)

Want to make a website, but found w3c's tutorials too boring? We'll teach you HTML and CSS from scratch. Come down to get hands-on experience in designing beautiful webpages, and walk away with a basic, personalized website. Remember to bring your own laptop!

NUSHackers will be conducting their first workshop in the hackerschool series, "Introduction to HTML and CSS", on 4th Feb, Saturday, at Seminar Room 3, School of Computing, and the workshop is completely free. Anyone from any faculty is welcome.

This workshop is absolutely FREE! Sign up now at school.nushackers.org!
events.location: NUS School of Computing, 13 Computing Drive, Singapore 117417
